rComments: An excellent lecturer.  Attend class and take amazing notes and you will get a great grade.  Everything you need to know is straight from the readings and lectures. She's passionate about the material and it shows during class.  She does not post slides lectures so class attendance is a must.  Great smile too.

Lectures are dry and rarely correlate with the required readings. Readings are boring! Uses slideshows during lectures  but what she says is more important than what is on the slides. The class felt more like a history class than anything else. Also, her paper prompts are so vague,not a fan of her style and will avoid taking another class with her.

Ive take poli 128 and 120, elections and her democracy class. Election was amazing, very cool material, easy midterm and papers if you actually payed attention in class. ALL YOU NEED TO DO IS WRITE DOWN EVERYTHING SHE SAYS IN CLASS! You can easy do both papers based on her lectures. 120 was disappointing, boring material. Felt like a history class.

It was clear that it was her first quarter teaching.  The class was supposed to be about American Political Development with regard to race, class & gender, but we rarely talked about those issues which was disappointing.  Seemed a lot like a high school AP US History class the way she taught it.  Not a fan of her teaching style.

She was my favorite professor so far! I heard she is a hard grader, but I got my essay revised a few times (for free, on campus and by peers) and received a high A. In my opinion, your grade reflects how much effort you apply. WARNING: She doesn't put her slides up online and she talks quite fast. Don't hesitate to tell her to repeat something.

Tough Class. She's a super tough grader and not very helpful. She's looking for very specific things in your writing and you HAVE to buy into it. The TA grades everything except the final paper. Class itself is just 1 paper a midterm and. Like I said, tough class, know what you're getting in to.

Professor Springer just started teaching at UCSC this quarter and she is amazing! This class is fairly designed for anyone who is interested in learning about elections and voting in the U.S. There was 1 in class midterm, 1 take home midterm essay and 1 final take home essay, attendance and participation is required-she takes attendance randomly!
